title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
text: Rationale validation method estimating anaerobic threshold described Conconi et al. (1996), also disputed e.g. Jeukendrup et al. (1997) Hofmann et al. (1997) (see References).

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
text: Use chest strap heart rate monitor available. set treadmill 1% incline compensate lack wind resistance warm jogging treadmill slow speed 10 minutes rest 10 minutes light static dynamic stretching start low speed can still jog, run, several steps hit anaerobic threshold. 6km/h likely choice. km/h likely better mph smaller steps speed. spend 90 seconds speed. 90 seconds, increase speed 1 km/h continue exhaustion, can longer maintain speed. test ends end last segment full 90 seconds completed. end test, can remain still several minutes heart rate monitor still recording, separately measure compare rate recovery. Analysis heart rate recovery isn’t currently handled package however.

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
text: Open workout web version Garmin Connect. Click gearbox upper right-hand side:  , export TCX:

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
text: Actually don’t need import TCX file, matters fitmodel() function provide data.frame columns time, heart_rate, optionally speed. import TCX file Garmin Connect, may need rename column containing heart rate heart_rate column containing time time. time column seconds format can coerced seconds using .numeric(), POSIXct/POSIXlt formats services likely provide. useDeviceSpeed FALSE, speed column speed.

what: How to figure out startminutes and endminutes
title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
text: Useful case run started start actual step test, ended .    iteratively adjusting startminutes endminutes replotting, just replotting adjusted axes, found correct start time 0.15 minutes correct end time 15 minutes.
code: library(ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest) fname = system.file("extdata/2023-01-16.tcx", package = "ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest") tmp <- prepdata(fname, startminutes = 0, endminutes = 100,           useDeviceSpeed = TRUE) plot(tmp$minutes, tmp$speed) plot(tmp$minutes, tmp$cadence_running) plot(tmp$minutes, tmp$heart_rate)

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
text: Import data show plots.
code: dat202301 <- prepdata(fname, startminutes = 0.15, endminutes = 15,           useDeviceSpeed = FALSE) (dat202301$date = substr(dat202301$time[1], 1, 10)) #> [1] "2023-01-16" plot(dat202301$minutes, dat202301$speed) plot(dat202301$minutes, dat202301$cadence_running) plot(dat202301$minutes, dat202301$heart_rate)

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
text: model uses available data points:  model uses final 5 measurements step:
code: fitmodel(dat202301, alldata = TRUE, title = "January 2023, using all HR data") #> [1] "Threshold alpha: 11.8861748818112" #> [1] "" #> [1] "Model coefficients: Beta[0], Beta[1], Beta[2]" #> (Intercept)           x           w  #>   63.027275    9.167789   -5.201732 #> fitmodel(dat202301, alldata = FALSE, title = "January 2023, using only last 5 HR measurements of each step") #> [1] "Threshold alpha: 12.3667609360595" #> [1] "" #> [1] "Model coefficients: Beta[0], Beta[1], Beta[2]" #> (Intercept)           x           w  #>   73.442849    8.242858   -4.842851 #>

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
code: fname = system.file("extdata/2023-09-15.tcx", package = "ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest") dat202309 <- prepdata(fname, startminutes = 23.8, endminutes = 40.1,           useDeviceSpeed = FALSE) dat202309$date = substr(dat202309$time[1], 1, 10) with(dat202309, plot(minutes, speed))

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
code: fitmodel(dat202309, alldata = TRUE, title = "September 2023, using all HR data") #> [1] "Threshold alpha: 14.5862765638889" #> [1] "" #> [1] "Model coefficients: Beta[0], Beta[1], Beta[2]" #> (Intercept)           x           w  #>   76.921892    7.205029   -4.961977 #> fitmodel(dat202309, alldata = FALSE, title = "September 2023, using only last 5 HR measurements of each step") #> [1] "Threshold alpha: 14.3405968989953" #> [1] "" #> [1] "Model coefficients: Beta[0], Beta[1], Beta[2]" #> (Intercept)           x           w  #>   82.822218    6.880000   -4.279986 #>

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
code: fname = system.file("extdata/2022-01-10.tcx", package = "ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest") dat202201 <- prepdata(fname, startminutes = 26, endminutes = 38.99,           useDeviceSpeed = FALSE) dat202201$date = substr(dat202201$time[1], 1, 10)

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
code: fitmodel(dat202201, alldata = TRUE, title = "January 2022, using all HR data") #> [1] "Threshold alpha: 10.4210375092312" #> [1] "" #> [1] "Model coefficients: Beta[0], Beta[1], Beta[2]" #> (Intercept)           x           w  #>   76.397735    9.484450   -4.844825 #> fitmodel(dat202201, alldata = FALSE, title = "January 2022, using only last 5 HR measurements of each step") #> [1] "Threshold alpha: 9.63106140240239" #> [1] "" #> [1] "Model coefficients: Beta[0], Beta[1], Beta[2]" #> (Intercept)           x           w  #>   78.199938   10.080009   -6.180004 #>

title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
text: plots demonstrating comparison two tests. First join two data.frames, convert date speed factors (make plots appear way want ).
code: xall <- full_join(x=dat202309, y=dat202301) |>     full_join(y=dat202201) |>     mutate(date = factor(date)) |>     mutate(speed = factor(speed)) #> Joining with `by = join_by(time, latitude, longitude, altitude, distance, #> heart_rate, speed, cadence_running, cadence_cycling, power, temperature, #> minutes, date)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(time, latitude, longitude, altitude, distance, #> heart_rate, speed, cadence_running, cadence_cycling, power, temperature, #> minutes, date)`

what: Boxplot of heart rate vs speed
title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
code: ggplot(xall, aes(x=speed, y=heart_rate, fill = date)) +     geom_boxplot()  +     scale_y_continuous(breaks=seq(90, 200, by=10))

what: Scatterplot with Loess smoothing curve for heart rate vs speed
title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
code: ggplot(xall, aes(x = minutes, y = heart_rate, color = date)) +     geom_point(size = 0.5)  +     geom_smooth() +     scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(90, 200, by = 10), name = "Heart Rate (bpm)") +     scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(0, 16.5, by = 1.5), name = "Time (minutes)",                         sec.axis = sec_axis( ~ . / 1.5 + 6,                                              name = "speed (km/h)",                                              breaks = seq(6, 16, by = 1))) #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'

what: Scatterplot with Loess smoothing curve for running cadence vs speed
title: Analysis of Garmin TCX data for Conconi anaerobic threshold test
code: filter(xall, date != "2022-01-10") |> # bad cadence data from 2022-01-10     ggplot(aes(         x = as.numeric(as.character(speed)),         y = 2 * cadence_running,         color = date     )) +     geom_point(size = 0.5)  +     geom_smooth() +     scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(150, 200, by = 10), name = "Cadence (spm)") +     scale_x_continuous(         breaks = seq(0, 16.5, by = 1),         name = "speed (km/h)",         sec.axis = sec_axis(~ . / 1.5 + 6,                             name = "speed (km/h)",                             breaks = seq(6, 16, by = 1))     ) #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Authors and Citation
text: Levi Waldron. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Waldron L (2024). ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest: Conconi et al. Estimate Anaerobic Threshold TCX File. R package version 1.0.0, https://github.com/waldronlab/ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest: Conconi et al. Estimate of Anaerobic Threshold from a TCX File},   author = {Levi Waldron},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/waldronlab/ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest}, }

title: Fit piecewise linear model — fitmodel
text: Fit piecewise linear model

title: Fit piecewise linear model — fitmodel
text: dat data.frame output prepdata() function alldata FALSE (default), final 5 heart rate measurements step used fit changepoint model. TRUE, data used. textsize size breakpoint speed & pace text printed plot (default: 5) title title plot (default: '')

title: Fit piecewise linear model — fitmodel
text: creates plot showing piecewise fit breakpoint

title: Fit piecewise linear model — fitmodel
code: fname = system.file(file = "extdata/2023-09-15.tcx", package = "ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest") x1 <- prepdata(fname, startminutes = 23.8, endminutes = 40.1,          useDeviceSpeed = FALSE) fitmodel(x1) #> [1] "Threshold alpha: 14.3405968989953" #> [1] "" #> [1] "Model coefficients: Beta[0], Beta[1], Beta[2]" #> (Intercept)           x           w  #>   82.822218    6.880000   -4.279986  #>

what: Load, trim, fit, and display model — prepdata
title: Load, trim, fit, and display model — prepdata
text: Load, trim, fit, display model

title: Load, trim, fit, and display model — prepdata
code: prepdata(   fname,   startminutes = 0,   endminutes = 1000,   speedmin = 6,   speedstep = 1,   timestep = 1.5,   useDeviceSpeed = FALSE )

title: Load, trim, fit, and display model — prepdata
text: fname Path tcx file startminutes Time (default: 0 minutes) start first step endminutes Time (default: 1000, minutes) end last step speedmin (default: 6 km/h) Speed first step (set treadmill) speedstep (default: 1 km/h) Speed increment step timestep (default: 1.5 minutes) Length time step minutes useDeviceSpeed (default: FALSE) TRUE, use speed returned device instead manually-set step speeds

title: Load, trim, fit, and display model — prepdata
text: data.frame early late times potentially trimmed, speed potentially -ridden manually set step values.

title: Load, trim, fit, and display model — prepdata
text: Actually need import TCX file, matters `fitmodel()` function data.frame columns `time`, `heart_rate`, optionally `speed`. import TCX file Garmin, may need rename column containing heart rate `heart_rate` column containing time `time`. `time` column seconds format can coerced seconds using `.numeric()`, POSIXct/POSIXlt formats services likely provide. `useDeviceSpeed` FALSE, speed column `speed`.

title: Load, trim, fit, and display model — prepdata
code: fname = system.file(file = "extdata/2023-09-15.tcx", package = "ConconiAnaerobicThresholdTest") # These plots can help get the start and end time correct. x0 <- prepdata(fname, useDeviceSpeed = TRUE) par(mfrow=c(2, 2)) plot(x0$minutes, x0$speed) plot(x0$minutes, x0$cadence_running) plot(x0$minutes, x0$heart_rate) # Once you have start and end times correct, set useDeviceSpeed = FALSE # if speeds were set manually on the treadmill. x1 <- prepdata(fname, startminutes = 23.8, endminutes = 40.1,          useDeviceSpeed = FALSE) par(mfrow=c(2, 2))  plot(x1$minutes, x1$speed) plot(x1$minutes, x1$cadence_running) plot(x1$minutes, x1$heart_rate)
